title: David Beckham's Inter Miami reveal artist's impression of brand new stadium ahead of 2020 MLS entry
text:
Inter Miami have teased ambitious plans of their brand new £750million stadium ahead of their eagerly-anticipated MLS entry in 2020.

In a video released on their Instagram page, David Beckham's new MLS side have teased a spectacular guide to their stadium, which remarkably includes a rooftop bar and palm trees on the roof.

Beckham's dream is starting to turn into reality as he looks to bring top-flight football back to Miami.

Inter Miami have released a teasing video of their brand new £750million stadium

The brand new state-of-the-art stadium will be something spectacular when its finally built

There will be a rooftop bar at the stadium, while palm trees will also be a unique feature

The social media video, which is of an artist's impression, portrays a magnificent single-tier wall behind one of the goals at Miami Freedom Park.

But even better is the fact that they have planned to put a luxurious rooftop top bar in place, so that supporters can enjoy the experience in pure comfort and style, while palm trees also feature around the stadium.

Despite the excitement surrounding their brand new arena, Inter Miami's plans hit a snag and it won't actually be completed until 2022.

In August, The Miami Herald reported that an environmental analysis found arsenic contamination reaching more than twice the legal limit, and surface-level soil samples containing hazardous debris at the Melreese golf course site - which has delayed the plans.

David Beckham's MLS side's new stadium will not actually be completed until 2022

A video, from an artist's impression, was released on Instagram on Tuesday afternoon

The consultant's report said that almost the entire site near Miami International Airport was contaminated by ash from a municipal incinerator shut down long ago.

Miami Mayor Francis Suarez said that team officials claimed the findings could increase cleanup costs to $50 million at the site.

The ultimate goal is to move into their brand new 25,000-seater stadium but they will have to wait a while.

So ahead of their 2020 entry into the MLS, they are now building two stadiums - with their first home being in Fort Lauderdale, which is a one-hour drive from downtown Miami.

The Lockhart Stadium being built in Fort Lauderdale will host Inter Miami for their first two seasons in the MLS before being transformed into a training centre.
